text: Marlborough College is a secondary boarding school in Marlborough, Wiltshire, England. It was started in 1843 for sons of the leaders of the Church of England. It now accepts boys and girls of all religious beliefs, but is classed as a Church of England school. It has a chapel where there is Eucharist every Sunday. It is a member of the G20 Schools Group. It costs Â£32,280 a year. == History == First Established in 1849 == References == Category:Schools in England Category:Wiltshire Category:1843 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1840s establishments in England
title: Marlborough College
